Package de.kaleidox.vban

Class VBAN<D>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.OutputStream
      • de.kaleidox.vban.VBAN<D>
  • Type Parameters:
    D - Generic-type for the
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    public class VBAN<D>
extends java.io.OutputStream
    Facade class for interacting with the API.

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void close()
      Drops the Socket and PacketFactory object and marks this stream as closed. Any attempt to send data after closing the stream will result in an IOException being thrown.

      Sends this stream's byte buffer to the specified address on the specified port, then clears the byte buffer.

      Writes one byte to this stream's byte buffer, but does not send anything.
      void writeFlush​(byte[] b)
      Writes an array of bytes to this stream's byte buffer, then tries to send the byte buffer.

    • Method Detail

      • sendData

        public VBAN<D> sendData​(D data)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Tries to send the given data to the specified address on the specified port.
        Parameters:
        data - The data to send. Is converted to a bytearray using Util.createByteArray(Object).
        Returns:
        The instance of the stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the stream has been closed before.
        java.io.IOException - See DatagramSocket.send(DatagramPacket) for details.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the converted byte-array from the given data is too large.

      • write

        public void write​(int b)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes one byte to this stream's byte buffer, but does not send anything. The byte buffer is being sent and cleared by invoking flush(). If the character-code of \n is written, the stream is flushed, to ensure a 1:1 ratio of lines:writes.
        Specified by:
        write in class java.io.OutputStream
        Parameters:
        b - The byte as an int to append.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the stream has been closed before.
        java.io.IOException - See DatagramSocket.send(DatagramPacket) for details.

      • flush

        public void flush()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Sends this stream's byte buffer to the specified address on the specified port, then clears the byte buffer.
        Specified by:
        flush in interface java.io.Flushable
        Overrides:
        flush in class java.io.OutputStream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the stream has been closed before.
        java.io.IOException - See DatagramSocket.send(DatagramPacket) for details.

      • close

        public void close()
        Drops the Socket and PacketFactory object and marks this stream as closed. Any attempt to send data after closing the stream will result in an IOException being thrown.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Overrides:
        close in class java.io.OutputStream

      • writeFlush

        public void writeFlush​(@NotNull
                       byte[] b)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Writes an array of bytes to this stream's byte buffer, then tries to send the byte buffer.
        Parameters:
        b - The bytes to send.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the stream has been closed before.
        java.io.IOException - See DatagramSocket.send(DatagramPacket) for details.

      • writeFlush

        public void writeFlush​(@NotNull
                       byte[] b,
                       int off,
                       int len)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a subset from an array of bytes to this stream's byte buffer, then tries to send the byte buffer.
        Parameters:
        b - The byte array to create a subset from.
        off - The offset for the subset in the array.
        len - The length of the subset to be sent in the array.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the stream has been closed before.
        java.io.IOException - See DatagramSocket.send(DatagramPacket) for details.

      • openByteStream

        public static VBAN<ByteArray> openByteStream​(Factory<VBANPacket> packetFactory,
                                             java.net.InetAddress address,
                                             int port)
                                      throws java.net.SocketException
        Opens a VBAN stream after the given specifications.
        Parameters:
        packetFactory - A factory that creates new, empty VBANPackets.
        address - The InetAddress to send this stream's data to.
        port - The port to send data to.
        Returns:
        A new VBAN stream that can accept a ByteArray with sendData(Object).
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketException - See DatagramSocket constructor.

      • openTextStream

        public static VBAN<java.lang.String> openTextStream​(int port)
                                             throws java.net.SocketException,
                                                    java.net.UnknownHostException
        Opens a VBAN Remote Text stream to the specified port on localhost.
        Parameters:
        port - The port to send data to.
        Returns:
        A new VBAN stream that can accept a String with sendData(Object).
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketException - See DatagramSocket constructor.
        java.net.UnknownHostException - See InetAddress.getLocalHost().

      • openTextStream

        public static VBAN<java.lang.String> openTextStream​(java.net.InetAddress address,

        port - The port to send data to.
